channel.title: [Google] See Full Size Images in Firefox without going to a new site!
channel.description:
[center]TY Ron for the title idea! [/center]
Well, you know when your googling pics and want to see them full-size and it takes you to another site? Well here's a small trick on how not to go to a new site.
Right click on the "See full-size image.", select "Copy image location", get a new tab and paste it there and press enter, full size pics for you. :)

item.title: [Google] See Full Size Images in Firefox without going to a new site!
item.dc:creator: @littlesoul littlesoul
item.description:
@littlesoul wrote:

Im sorry but i cant see how right clicking and then copying and opening a new window ( waiting for that) ( or tab) then pasting then waiting for image is quicker then click the link… mite be rong be you nether know -.- inless im missing the point

Read full topic
item.source: [Google] See Full Size Images in Firefox without going to a new site!

item.title: [Google] See Full Size Images in Firefox without going to a new site!
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

bumr055:

you can get a plugin called “cooliris preview” and you just put your mouse over the pick and it emulates a page opening up and you get the full picture so you can right click and save it… its good for previeing site on the normal google search too… instead of opening it in the same page, new window, or tab… it will open a small screen inside of firefox… and you can take a quick look and then close that preview.

Yeah, I use this plugin. Handy.

Read full topic
item.source: [Google] See Full Size Images in Firefox without going to a new site!

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“LegendaryLoser, post:11, topic:5165”]1) A 4 month old topic bumper
2) A 1 month old topic bumper

stop…[/quote]

It was generally a useful post, but mr me has been banned so think before you spam.

Note to all: if the image url is set to redirect as well then this won’t work(aka custom 404 page?).

Read full topic
